Description: St Antony; the saint standing, holding a rosary, with the pig beside his feet; inscribed below; third state Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Israhel van Meckenem
Curator's comments: Part of a suite of four sheets, divided in four compartments, each containing a saint (L 305-308). The present engraving is a compartment of Sheet 2, which additionally contained St Cornelius, Hubert and Quirin. A duplicate is on the same mount.
Bibliographic references: Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (IX.254.306.D.III)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (306.D)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased through: F A C Prestel (sale Frankfurt, 16.v.1870/483)
